intro: Anaxagorea brevipedicellata, commonly known as the short-stalked talaud, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, often in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the tropical flora in its native habitat.
